name: sprinkle socks
notes:
**this pattern was designed as a mystery sock (mock) for the january/february 2026 stranded colorwork challenge in the sock knitters anonymous group on ravelry.** the pattern is divided into a series of four clues to be released on january 1, 8, 15, and 22 of 2026. because it is designed as a mystery, no photos of the socks are present in any of the clues and all project pages should use a spoiler shield as the first photo when knitting along with the kal. **materials:** fingering weight sock yarn in 2 colors. designer used knit picks hawthorne in colorways burlingame and klamath falls. • color 1 (c1) – 50-60 g • color 2 (c2) – 40-50 g it’s recommended that one color is solid and the other is solid, semi-solid/tonal, or speckled, and there is good contrast between the yarns with no shared colors. the charts are designed so that color 1 (c1) is lighter in value than color 2 (c2). yarn amounts are estimates and will vary depending on pattern size, leg, and foot length. us size 1 (2.25 mm) & size 1.5 (2.5 mm) circular needles • or sizes needed for fit - a larger needle (2.5 mm) may be necessary to get gauge in colorwork plus one size smaller for the ribbing, heel, and toe (2.25 mm). • this pattern is written for magic loop but can be adapted to your preferred needle type – tips for other methods are given in the instructions. for magic loop, i recommend circular needles of at least 32” to work one sock, but i prefer 40-47”. locking/removable stitch markers (4) & tapestry needle **gauge** 8-9 spi (stitches per inch) in 2-color stranded colorwork using larger needles (size 1.5 - 2.5 mm) * at 9 spi, the sock will be 7.3" (8", 8.7”) in circumference. * at 8 spi, the sock will be 8.25" (9", 9.75”) in circumference.
